qas.question: Where created the first practical integrated circuits?

answers.text: Jack Kilby at Texas Instruments and Robert Noyce at Fairchild Semiconductor.

qas.question: Where did Jack Kilby work at when he created the first IC?
When was the first functional IC demonstrated?
What was Kilby's IC made of?
Noyce's IC was made up of what material?

context: The first practical ICs were invented by <a0_0>Jack Kilby at <a1_0>Texas Instruments<a1_0/> and Robert Noyce at Fairchild Semiconductor.<a0_0/> Kilby recorded his initial ideas concerning the integrated circuit in July 1958, successfully demonstrating the first working integrated example on <a2_0>12 September 1958.<a2_0/> In his patent application of 6 February 1959, Kilby described his new device as "a body of semiconductor material ... wherein all the components of the electronic circuit are completely integrated". Noyce also came up with his own idea of an integrated circuit half a year later than Kilby. His chip solved many practical problems that Kilby's had not. Produced at Fairchild Semiconductor, it was made of <a4_0>silicon<a4_0/>, whereas Kilby's chip was made of <a3_0>germanium<a3_0/>.
